intro: Papaver polytrichum, commonly known as the hairy poppy, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its striking, bright red flowers with a prominent black center, which appear in late spring to early summer. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Papaver polytrichum is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and rocky habitats.
